task.name: imtrans
task.example:
PARAMETER SUMMARY imagename Name of the input image outfile Name of output CASA image order Output zero-based axes order
The task imtrans transposes an image (both pixel values and coordinate axes) to the specified new axes order. The order parameter describes the mapping of the input axes to the output axes. It contains zero-based digits describing the new order of the input axes. It must contain the same number of (unique) digits as the number of input axes. For example, specifying reorder="1032" for a four axes image maps input axes 0, 1, 2, 3 to output axes 1, 0, 3, 2. Because of ambiguity for axes numbers greater than nine, this method cannot currently handle images containing more than 10 axes. The task returns an image analysis tool attached to the new image.
EXAMPLE: # Swap the stokes and spectral axes in an RA-Dec-Stokes-Frequency image imagename = "myim.im" outfile = "outim.im" order = "0132"
